functional_jobs.job_statement: When I am planning events for the Newcomers Club, I want to utilize the website and app effectively, so I can ensure smooth event registration and management.
functional_jobs.current_solution: Using the Wild Apricot application for managing events and registrations.
functional_jobs.pain_points: The phone app is underpowered, provides conflicting information, and is not user-friendly for all members.
functional_jobs.desired_outcomes: A more reliable and user-friendly mobile app that provides accurate event registration information.
functional_jobs.success_criteria: Members can easily register for events and access accurate information through their preferred devices without confusion.

functional_jobs.job_statement: When I am involved in committee work, I want to access administrative features on the website, so I can manage events effectively.
functional_jobs.current_solution: Logging in as an administrator to view backend features.
functional_jobs.pain_points: The administrative interface is complex and not well documented for new users.
functional_jobs.desired_outcomes: An intuitive administrative interface with better training resources for new committee members.
functional_jobs.success_criteria: Committee members can navigate the administrative functions efficiently and manage events without frustration.

emotional_jobs.job_statement: When I am hosting an event, I want to feel confident in the registration process, so I can ensure that attendees have a positive experience.
emotional_jobs.current_solution: Using printed name tags and maintaining accurate registration records.
emotional_jobs.pain_points: Worry about unregistered attendees showing up, which can lead to confusion and embarrassment.
emotional_jobs.desired_outcomes: A reliable system that prevents registration issues and ensures all attendees are accounted for.
emotional_jobs.success_criteria: A seamless registration experience with printed name tags that help identify attendees correctly.

social_jobs.job_statement: When I attend events, I want to be recognized as an involved member of the Newcomers Club, so I can feel a sense of belonging and community.
social_jobs.current_solution: Using printed name tags to denote roles such as 'newbie' or 'committee member'.
social_jobs.pain_points: Informal name tags can lead to misidentification and diminish the sense of community.
social_jobs.desired_outcomes: Clear identification of members' roles to foster connections among attendees.
social_jobs.success_criteria: Attendees can easily identify each other’s roles and engage more meaningfully at events.

supporting_jobs.job_statement: When I am training new committee members, I want to provide them with adequate resources, so they can quickly learn how to use the website effectively.
supporting_jobs.pain_points: Current training methods are inadequate and lead to confusion among new users.
supporting_jobs.desired_outcomes: A structured training program that equips new members with the knowledge they need to use the website.
supporting_jobs.success_criteria: New committee members feel confident and competent in using the website after training.

supporting_jobs.job_statement: When managing events, I want to have a system that archives past events and decisions, so I can ensure continuity and avoid repeating past mistakes.
supporting_jobs.current_solution: Relying on informal notes and memory.
supporting_jobs.pain_points: Lack of institutional memory leads to repeated issues and inefficiencies.
supporting_jobs.desired_outcomes: A formalized archival process that documents past events and decisions.
supporting_jobs.success_criteria: Committee members can easily access historical data to inform their planning and decision-making.
